fields.description:

It would be nice to have a per-repository switch to disable this, since these messages can refer to something completely different.

fields.description:
I'm trying to create a repository via REST but it's not working. I believe the request is correct because I'm using the Apigee console you provided, using the standard settings. Here are the steps to reproduce:

# Select basic auth and enter credentials
# Try 'GET user/' to make sure the credentials are correct
# From the left panel, select 'POST repositories/'
# In the 'Template' tab, enter required field 'accountname' (easycompanyit) + 'repo_slug' (test006)
# In the 'Body' tab, enter required field 'name' (test006)
# Click 'send'

The request can be viewed here: https://snap.apigee.com/TX9qKK#content=request\\
The response here: https://snap.apigee.com/TX9qKK

Thanks already!

Rolf
fields.summary: Cannot create repository with REST API

fields.description:
Hi, I believe, that issue which is "on hold" should still be visible in "open issues" as it is not resolved (and is probably waiting for something)

Way to reproduce:

# Create new issue
# Use workflow button to set it "on hold"
# Return to issues
# From "Open","My issues","All" select "Open"
# You don't see your issue
fields.summary: Issue "on hold" is still open issue

fields.description:
It would be very informative for the users of the downloads if there was an info line, e.g. "Debian Testing .deb files for x86_64".\\
Right now all information has to be in the file name. That's ugly and not practicable.

Info and name fields are available for downloads in googlecode and github, too.\\
Regards
fields.summary: Downloads need names or info fields (BB-6932)

fields.description:
It would be nice if the filter used to display Markdown files in the source view would render the HTML {{<strike>}} tag. I know this isn't supported for security reasons. However, it would still be cool if you could figure out a way to make a small subset of HTML tags work securely.

I have a todo list in the Markdown syntax and when I'm finished with a task I like to mark it as finished by wrapping the item in the {{<strike>}} tag.

Example:

{code}
:::markdown
    TODO
    ====

    - Item 1
    - Item 2
    - Item 3
    
    FINISHED
    ========

    - <strike>Item 4</strike>
    - <strike>Item 5</strike>
    - <strike>Item 6</strike>
{code}
fields.summary: Markdown Support for a Small Subset of HTML Tags (BB-6931)

I'm configured to receive notifications when issues are raised in my repository. I tend not to need a notification when I'm the one submitting the issue, only when someone else does.\\
Can this be an option (or the logical default)?\\
Thanks.

Let me know if there is any way that I can resolve this.

when I install the tortoisehg-2.6.0-hg-2.4-x86.msi on a windows 2008r2 64bit machine, the installer pops up a dialog which says "the x86 installer may not be used on a x64 platform" and I have to click finish button to exit the install process. Nothing installed.

I would like to install 32bit TGH on a 64bit machine, because the 32bit verison has the most compatibility of any extensions. What do you think?

fields.description:
I created an account yesterday for a work email address, but realised that I already had a bitbucket account (the one I'm reporting from).

I immediately deleted the account, and then tried to add the work address to my previously existing account.  This wasn't possible because it claimed that the email address was in use.

I also suspected that maybe the user being part of a team might have been keeping it in the system, but removing it from the team has not resolved the problem either.

The account seems to be in a quasi-existing state where:

# I can reset the password.
# I can view the profile.
# I can't log in.
# I can't use the email address.

Basically this email address has now been rendered completely unusable.  Could we have some intervention to have this account fully removed?

Thanks.
fields.summary: Deleted account is still treated as existing (BB-6928)

fields.description:
The way Bitbucket pull requests currently handle branch closing, by merging first and then closing, works against the grain of Mercurial: it creates a dangling head for each branch-closing commit, which clutters the repository history, and frustrates features like {{hg pull -r <rev>}} (which won't pull in the closing commits relevant to the target revision).

For this reason, the usually recommended way of closing and merging branches in Mercurial is to close them _before_ merging them: see e.g. [here|http://blog.stevehorn.cc/blog/mercurial-close-named-branch] and [here|http://mercurial.aragost.com/kick-start/en/tasks/#closing-a-branch]. This  makes for a cleaner and more readable history, and avoids the usability problems above.

Can the branch closing feature for Mercurial repositories be changed to work this way?

(Alternatively, if there are users who for some reason insist on the current close-after-merge behavior, can both options be supported?)
fields.summary: Close feature branches in pull requests *before* merging them for hg (BB-6927)

fields.description: At the moment it's ordered by name (a to z). However people are more likely to access their recently active projects than the projects that are effectively just archived.
fields.summary: Repositories Dashboard Box: Order By Activity

fields.description:
My hg repository appears to be corrupted and I can not browse it now. (This is the debug code I get: 17f8f6968bbd447aaf542ecd1bcdea42$efb3f185c90c2682a60ea94efedb8fef)

I resolved the issue by creating new repository but still it would be nice to be able to get the current status of repository via web-interface and maybe perform some repair actions.
fields.summary: Provide a way to run "hg verify" etc from the repository admin section (BB-1627)

fields.description:
Hi

I think it could be useful if deployment keys syntax supported OpenSSH-style constraints added to keys. I mean especially from="" syntax (see http://www.eng.cam.ac.uk/help/jpmg/ssh/authorized_keys_howto.html)

It would prevent some problems in case of leakage of a key or will bring possbility to deploy only from specific (trusted) locations.
fields.summary: Support OpenSSH-style host constraints (from="") on SSH/deployment keys (BB-6926)
Add a repository specific email header so that you can filter on it (BB-6925)

fields.description:
Currently, it's possible to assign an issue to a specific user, or team. There's no mechanism to CC someone on an issue, or request his involvement by replying to the issue discussion.

Naturally, I think that mentioning someone by his nickname in an issue (@ nick), should send him an email containing the issue he was mentioned in. In case of a private repository, the user must have access to this repository to prevent sending classified issues to unauthorized user by mistake.
fields.summary: Notify issues to mentioned users by mail (BB-7130)

fields.description:
Hi,

We recently went from Jira OnDemand SVN to Git on BitBucket.

One thing we miss alot, is the ability to demand users entering a Jira issue key, when checking in code.

I know that Git is distributed, and a lot of the checkin/commit stuff is handled locally.\\
But if i Jira issue check was done by BitBucket, no code could be added to "final destination" without an Jira issue key defined in the commit description.

So this feature request is, that you possibly come up with a clever idea for this :o)

Best regards\\
Peter Meyer
fields.summary: Option to reject commits without an issue key in their message (BB-2415)

fields.description: There is a "parent" link, but no "children" links.  I think there used to be, but I don't recall for certain.  Mercurial's built-in web interface has links for both 'parents' and 'children.'  This is a very useful feature.
fields.summary: No 'children' links in changeset view

fields.description:
Hi,

Two things, one arguably a bug but a minor one, and one probably a feature request:

# I deleted some repos, but they continue to clutter up my "recently viewed" list. Since deleting a repo is not a reversible operation, they should be removed from the recently viewed list automatically.
# Even without deleting repos, I should be able to remove them from my "recently viewed" list (or at least clear the list).

Thanks,

-- T.J.
fields.summary: Remove deleted repos from my "recently viewed" list (BB-6923)

fields.description: When you fork a repository for a specific reason, you put the reason for the fork in the description field in the Admin page for the repository. For example, I forked vinay.sajip/django from django/django-hg-git, I did it to provide a Python 3 port of Django. That work is now done, and while I will keep this repository around for a while (it contains some changes which didn't make it into Django upstream), I have updated the description to reflect that I'm not updating this repository any more. However, that information is not available through the UI, AFAICT, so users might still fork the repo thinking it's in active use. In fact, I just got a notification of a fork today.
fields.summary: Repository description does not appear in overview page (BB-13535)

fields.description:
It would be nice to share a single issue tracker amongst several projects / repositories.\\
(or, alternatively, create several hg repositories in a given project)

Our situation (team optiflowsrd) is that we have several repositories for the different areas of our codebase, but it would make more sense to share the issues (since often an issue will have consequences on more than one code area).
fields.summary: Share issue tracker amongst projects

fields.description:
Links to Emoji objects with non-alphanumeric characters in the name are not recognized in Comments and Issues.

Examples:\\
(:bar_chart:)\\
(:e-mail:)\\
(:+1:)\\
(:-1:)
fields.summary: Some Emoji links are broken in Comments and Issues (BB-6921)

fields.description:
We would like to modify our workflow to require that a pull request requires as least two approvals from the team in order to merge into our master tree. Is this is already possible with bitbucket?

Obviously we can simply tell our project leads not to accept a pull request until two approvals show up, but we try to maintain a team-based mentality where no single member has totalitarian control. Having said that, it is sometimes difficult to ensure that every single change that makes it in has indeed been reviewed by multiple parties.
fields.summary: allow for pull requests to require approval (BB-6920)

So, I took a look at the downloads tab, and I can read the following message:\\
"We are currently updating the privacy flag for this repository's downloads, try again soon."

The last message is here for days, and I'm already not able to switch my repository privacy settings.

Following repository is the one I attempt to modify privacy:\\
https://bitbucket.org/FoxLegend/opal-gui-nbp
fields.summary: Unable to switch repository from private to public

fields.description:
When working in AppleScript, using Script Editor to save a file as text generally encodes it in Latin-9, or Mac OS Roman if accented characters are used. But if any characters not covered by those sets are present, the text file is encoded as UTF-16LE. And if such a file is clicked on in Bitbucket, the file is downloaded rather than displayed and colourized inline.

As an example, here's a UTF-16LE file: https://bitbucket.org/EricFromCanada/ericfromcanada.bitbucket.org/src/55865a3ee2bf/applescript/close%20Safari%20Web%20Inspector.applescript

And its next revision, after conversion to UTF-8+BOM:\\
https://bitbucket.org/EricFromCanada/ericfromcanada.bitbucket.org/src/51ba083a8253/applescript/close%20Safari%20Web%20Inspector.applescript
fields.summary: UTF-16 little endian files are downloaded rather than displayed (BB-6918)

https://bitbucket.org/keleran/scriptsnap

Reset, please.
fields.summary: Another repository is stuck in stripping process (BB-6715)

fields.description:
When I create a issue of a project having permission to commit, often change the issue's kind from "bug" to "task".

I think as follows:

* Project commiters mainly create "task" issues rather than "bug" issues
* On the other hand, project user mostly create "bug" (or "proposal") issues

So, i wish to change default kind of issue as follows.

* Login user is commiter: task
* Otherwise: bug
fields.summary: Change default kind of issue by whether login user is commiter or not

fields.description:
Hi there,

We use the events call to retrieve events related to the user's repos (https://api.bitbucket.org/1.0/repositories/{accountname}/{repo_slug}/events?limit=integer&start=integer&type=event). Now we saw that some events don't include the object's IDs, which make it impossible to make sense of the event. Here is an example of the report_issue event: node and description are null, no chance to get information on the ticket (title, description...):

...

{code}
{
    "node": null,
    "description": null,
    "repository": {
        "scm": "git",
        "has_wiki": false,
        "last_updated": "2012-12-09 02:43:46",
        "creator": null,
        "created_on": "2012-12-06 10:50:42",
        "owner": "cat_vasja",
        "logo": "https://dwz7u9t8u8usb.cloudfront.net/m/3007228f178f/img/language-avatars/java_16.png",
        "email_mailinglist": "",
        "is_mq": false,
        "size": 580,
        "read_only": false,
        "fork_of": null,
        "mq_of": null,
        "followers_count": 2,
        "state": "aclrehash",
        "utc_created_on": "2012-12-06 09:50:42+00:00",
        "website": "",
        "description": "",
        "has_issues": true,
        "is_fork": false,
        "slug": "repo-n2",
        "is_private": false,
        "name": "Repo N2",
        "language": "java",
        "utc_last_updated": "2012-12-09 01:43:46+00:00",
        "email_writers": true,
        "no_public_forks": false,
        "resource_uri": "/1.0/repositories/cat_vasja/repo-n2"
    },
    "created_on": "2012-12-09 02:50:54",
    "user": {
        "username": "cat_vasja",
        "first_name": "Vasja",
        "last_name": "Cat",
        "is_team": false,
        "avatar": "https://secure.gravatar.com/avatar/e16be80e861baccc5ed4691737faeb05?d=https%3A%2F%2Fdwz7u9t8u8usb.cloudfront.net%2Fm%2F3007228f178f%2Fimg%2Fdefault_avatar%2F32%2Fuser_blue.png&s=32",
        "resource_uri": "/1.0/users/cat_vasja"
    },
    "utc_created_on": "2012-12-09 01:50:54+00:00",
    "event": "report_issue"
},
{code}

...

Would be great to see this fixed soon. Thanks,\\
Martin
fields.summary: Missing IDs for issues and comments in events API (BB-6917)

fields.description:
The 'Commits' > 'Feature branches' tab list various branches, but the branch names aren't hyperlinked to the branch commit history page (as the 'All commits' page does) - i.e., to:

https://bitbucket.org/AC/REPO/commits/all/tip/BRANCH

Would be useful and presumably simple to add this link.

I'd further suggest a 'Branches' tab within 'Commits', also hyperlinked to the commit history for each? This could give an overview of available branches, last commit comment and date, etc, similar to "git branch -v".
fields.summary: 'Feature branches' tab should include links to each branch (BB-6913)

fields.description:
Currently custom regex links that try to link (#\d+) to other issue trackers are blocked - e.g., trying to link BCLOUD-123 to Redmine.

This would be understandable when JIRA integration or the BB Issue Tracker are enabled for that repo, but there's zero reason to block these types of regex when those are disabled - it smacks of an anti-competitive restriction. I hope this restriction can be lifted - thanks.
fields.summary: Support links to other issue trackers in Bitbucket specific issue strings (e.g., #123). (BB-6912)

https://bitbucket.org/semente/django-ibge/pull-requests\\
https://bitbucket.org/semente/django-ibge/pull-request/2/adding-the-slug-field-and-migrations-files
fields.summary: Pull request does not exists anymore but is still listed in pull requests page

fields.description:
We use pull requests as a form of code review; each team member works in a fork and uses pull request to get their code reviewed and included in the master repository. They work on issues that are in the master repo's issue tracker. When a team member references or closes an issue in the commit and that commit is accepted in a pull request, the issue is then updated by the user accepting the pull request.

It would be better in my opinion to have the issue update either by the team member issuing the pull request if that account is a team member on the repo to which the pull request is sent. If this is not the case the issue can be updated as it is now, by the account that accepts the pull request.
fields.summary: When closing an issue in the PullRequest merge dialog, make the issue transitioner to be the PullRequest author instead of the merger. (BB-6909)

fields.description: Example: https://bitbucket.org/semente/django-ibge/overview  (look at "South users" h3 title)
fields.summary: h3 html tag style is missing margin-top (BB-6908)

fields.summary: Error 500 on a commit page

fields.description:
The messy docs are located under the following url: https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/BITBUCKET/Plans+and+billing

It is messy in the section called "A free plan for a team account":

# "CoolioInc is a team account under the free plan. Patty created the account and she also has an individual account called PattyAlone."

so there is "PattyAlone"

# "Patty adds five individual accounts as members of CoolioInc --- Todd, John, Ellen, Frank, and here own PattyIndv account."

Now there is "PattyIndv" - is it meant to be "PattyAlone" or is it a separate account?

# "PatthyAlone is the only member of the Administrator group."

And now it is "Patthy" - notice "h" in the name.
fields.summary: Messy documentation regarding free Team accounts

fields.description:
After visiting https://bitbucket.org/petar/beam_integrals I've noticed README is no longer rendered properly on the repository overview page, as it has been for quite some time. It used to be parsed as ReST and then rendered as HTML, now it's rendered as pure plain text.

This has a big impact on usability as far as I can see.

Please get it back to the good olden days.

Thanks,
fields.summary: README not rendered properly on the repository overview page (BB-7160)

fields.description:
I stripped on https://bitbucket.org/michael_podlubny/sterilizer now, it's stuck at\\
Repository Unavailable This repository is currently being stripped. Please wait for a moment and then refresh this page or go to repository overview.
fields.summary: Repository unavailable after strip (BB-6715)

fields.description: Sometimes I capitalize Pull Request in the Issue or Pull Request comment area (ie. Pull Request BCLOUD-1 vs [PR#1|https://bitbucket.org/site/master/pull-requests/1]), and it gets missed by Markdown. It ignores the capitalized Pull Request and interprets BCLOUD-1 as an issue number.
fields.summary: Markdown doesn't recognize capitalized Pull Request #X (BB-6907)

fields.description:
When I search for a commit, by navigating to the 'Commit' item of the main project navigation and typing a word in the search field ('remove' in my case) I get the expected first page of the list of results. When I click on any of the numbers indicating pages, or the 'Next' button in the pager beneath the search results, the first page reloads.

I'm on Mac OS X 10.7.5, using FireFox 17.0.1.
fields.summary: Pager of commit search results broken

fields.description:
It would be a great usability improvement if we would be able to assign an issue directly from the issues list.

As of now, we have to open the issue, click the edit button, select the assignee and then hitting the save button.

Sometimes you are just planning a sprint or something and assigning tasks to your team and this would help a lot.

Thanks,\\
Gonzalo
fields.summary: Assign an issue directly from the issues list

fields.description:
Clone url includes the git clone operation but the clone url in the overview does not. It's confusing especially since the user will use it by copying whatever is in the field and most likely won't check whether it has or doesn't have the git clone operation.

They should be consistent either with or without the clone operation. (Stash does not include the clone operation)
fields.summary: Confusing clone URLs

fields.description:
When using POST service the Authorization header is NOT sent.

url format I am using:

https://user:password@hostname/some/paths?param=value

curl using that exact url DOES work and does send the Authorization header

( I can provide detailed ngrep data )
fields.summary: POST service does not send Authorization header. (BB-6988)

fields.description:
https://gunni.startssl.com

My StartSSL OpenID.

BTW, why not just allow arbritary providers by url?
fields.summary: Support StartSSL as an OpenID provider

fields.description:
This is happening every time I strip a changeset. Most recently, it occured on this repo:

https://bitbucket.org/stantonk/33810705-chore
fields.summary: There was an error while executing the strip task.

fields.description:
Hello,

One of my repositories is in an invalid state since I tried stripping a branch 4 or 5 hours ago.

I noticed 8 issues reported about the same subject, a few of them resolved.

Would you mind having a look?

Thanks in advance,

Monica
fields.summary: Repository unavailable (being stripped for hours now!)

fields.description: Hey, I'm using the POST service for post-receive to do BitBucket integration. I was expecting that the commits info in the broker payload containing the branch info. And when there is only one commit, it works as expected. However, when there are multiple commits pushing to BitBucket, the payload I received in the server is wrong. Exactly, only the last commit having the branch information, others will just be { "branches": [], "branch": null" }. Am I missing anything? Thanks very much!
fields.summary: Broker Payload is missing info when having multiple commits (BB-5354)
Side-by-side diff doesn't resizes after browser window resizing (BB-6904)

fields.description: Since a while, maybe 3 or 4 weeks, we're seeing that the POST service isn't invoked anymore on our repositories. We use that to trigger a jenkins build so it's very important to us that it works. I've noticed this behavior on multiple accounts, both my personal and our company team account.
fields.summary: POST service isn't executed anymore

fields.description:
MacOS Mountain Lion, Firefox 17.0.1

Workarount: Use Safari
fields.summary: Open ID login does not work on firefox (BB-6903)

fields.description:
When text is present before the bulleted list, the list is also treated as text and not displayed properly.\\
Like the one here

* first
* Second
fields.summary: Bulleted list not displayed correctly

fields.description:
Hello,

{code}
#!bash

$ find /my/repos
./Makefile/ex2/Makefile
./Makefile/ex2/print.c
./Makefile/ex2/main.c
./Makefile/Makefile
./Makefile/main.cpp
./Makefile/ex1/Makefile
./Makefile/ex1/print.cpp
./Makefile/ex1/main.cpp
./README.md
{code}

When i navigate on my repos with the website ui, the path bug (see attachments)

Best regards,
fields.summary: File and directory of same name confuse breadcrumbs in source browser. (BB-6902)

fields.description:
See title. Maybe the problem is the same as in BCLOUD-4794. As far as I understand it, the Mercurial issue that could be reason for the problem (http://bz.selenic.com/show_bug.cgi?id=3547) is still not fixed, so maybe a manual fix of the hgshelve repo, similar to the one in BCLOUD-4794 is required?

Brodie, I assigned it to you because you solved BCLOUD-4794 and probably know whats going on here.
fields.summary: Repo "tksoh/hgshelve" requires authorization although there are no changes to push

fields.description:
Profile information is public by default. This should be private by default or at least give the option to make it private.

Also, it would be appropriate to include a privacy option to not show people's  followers to the public.
fields.summary: Add ability to make profile private (BB-6901)

fields.description:
If you make several commits over a long period of time, with no activity in between, it seems that the Recent Activity feed groups them all together under the date of the last commit. This is somewhat misleading.

In the attached image, I made a commit 7 minutes ago, following two other commits made 12 days before that. They are all grouped under the heading of "7 minutes ago"

Apologies if I put this in the wrong component group. Not sure where to put it.
fields.summary: Recent Activity feed shows misleading commit dates.

fields.description: When I look at my own profile, I have the option to follow .. so I've clicked and now I am following myself, IMHO, one shouldn't follow themselve is .. weird?
fields.summary: Profile page - follow myself?

fields.description:
I downloadet the Zen Viewer today and I dont have voice. I'm a Mistress in SL and I need the voice. Any Idea why I dont get it.....\\
thanks\\
bsouder
fields.summary: no voice in SL

fields.description:
HI,

I am trying to push my spree application which contains multiple rails application within (i.e my own spree extensions). All the folders are pushing in to the bitbucket except the folder called "sandbox", please let me know your solution for this.

Thanks.
fields.summary: Unable to push spree application

fields.description: I'm a Chinese, Today, I type repo name careless with the Chinese. see my private repo name is 实习报告, and the git repo url is git@bitbucket.org:Roowe/----.git, I think this is a bug. My English is pool.I think you know my mean.
fields.summary: repo url is not correct

fields.description: I have one bitbucket username that I use for both work and personal stuff. I was wondering if there could be a way to associate my work email with my work team and my personal email with my personal team, so any notifications associated with that team be sent to their respective email addresses.
fields.summary: Teams with their own emails

fields.description:
Hi!\\
I have created Jira account with Bitbucket, I can connect to Jira account? but I can't connect to Bitbucket with Jira invitation. Password/login doesn't match and I cant reset pass, e-mail which I used to create Jira account doesn't exist in Bitbucker.
fields.summary: Can't login with Jira invitation

fields.description: Today I had an issue which wasn't closed by "Closes BCLOUD-573" message. A few days ago it worked without any problem.
fields.summary: Issues not closed automatically based on commit message
JavaScript

fields.description: When i click "clone in source tree" on your website Tower opens up on my computer. I do have source tree installed and I would prefer to use that..
fields.summary: Clone in source tree opens Tower?

fields.description: Atx-style headers (# header) on the first line of a markdown file are not recognised by the parser. See http://code.accursoft.com/hybrid/src/tip/Readme.md for an example.
fields.summary: Markdown not rendering atx-style headers on the first line of a file (BB-6797)

fields.description: Currently only has line commenting for Pull Requests and Commit Diffs. It would be great if this was extended to the Source browser as well.
fields.summary: Add line commenting to the source browser (BB-6805)

fields.description:
I think I reported this a while ago during pre-release/niptuck phase.

AUI project's link to JIRA keeps disappearing, I've reset it about four times now. No idea what the trigger could be.
fields.summary: jira link still not persisting

fields.description: test
fields.summary: test
